title.narrative: New Opportunities and Diversification in the Use of Nicaraguan Cocoa

description.narrative: The starting point for the project?Tasting, aroma and flavor profiles and study of the chemical profile of cocoa (other uses, particular case study of flavonoids) were pointed out by the actors in the cocoa value chain, both public and private at the time of drafting the National Cocoa Action Plan of Nicaragua. These were left as actions to be carried out by the private sector. APEN is part of these private actors and has decided to carry out this high priority action for the development of the cocoa sector.All the expected results of the project are actions prioritized in the National Cocoa Action Plan and have a social and scientific basis in the private sector of the cocoa value chain, organized in the Cocoa Commission of Nicaragua. These actions are complementary to ongoing and highly innovative efforts that will add value to the sub-sector and to the cocoa of the seven cooperatives that contribute to 69% of Nicaragua's cocoa exports.Which problem will be solved and what is the goal? It will resolve the dependence on a single method of fermentation and drying by a single buyer, diversify the potential use of cocoa, provide opportunities to access new market niches in the search for better prices. In addition, the local capacity of the seven cooperatives will remain intact with the application of new methods of fermentation and drying, as well as the preparation of samples for quality testing and tasting of cocoa. The objective is to develop local tools and capacities to diversify the use and highlight the taste and aroma of cocoa in seven cooperatives. How does this project solve the problem? The project will provide methodologies, tools and results that will serve to diversify the use and add value to the cocoa of small producers and will give an opportunity to access other markets. It will also create local capacity of 34 people from the seven cooperatives who will be able to apply different fermentation and drying methods, as well as prepare quality samples and taste the cocoa to define its profile of aromas and flavours.

comment.narrative: Due to Covid-19, requirements from buyers regarding food safety, health, safety of personnel in the food sector (cocoa in this case) have become even stricter. A follow-up project is being developed, to train cooperatives, for them to be able to comply with international standards and certifications. Producers will have improved access to international buyers and are able to sell their cocoa at better prices.
